snippet: An agreement on bank supervision is the latest attempt by the European Union to calm worries about banks, government finances and, by extension, its fundamental institutions.
abstract: Two-day summit meeting of the European Union’s 27 member states, ends with a pledge for common banking rules but no deal for a shared budget for the bloc; European Commission president Jose Manuel Barroso declared victory Friday over global financial markets.
lead_paragraph: An agreement on bank supervision is the latest attempt by the European Union to calm worries about banks, government finances and, by extension, its fundamental institutions.

headline.seo: After Fighting Markets, Europe Now Prefers Working With Them
headline.main: After Fighting Markets, Europe Now Prefers Working With Them
headline.print_headline: After Fighting Markets, Europe Now Prefers Working With Them
